result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles S Kelley Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied of $100.00. Costs and DNA to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/01/2022. Alternate for non payment is a civil judgment. Defendant to provide DNA sample to Waukesha Sheriff's dept

With Huber. Standard release conditions. REPORT TO HUBER BY 8/8/2022 by 6 pm. 
Credit time added of 24 days.
08/26/2022 DEFENDANT FAILED TO REPORT AS ORDERED. HUBER REVOKED. TO SERVE THE 50 DAYS AS STRAIGHT TIME.

Court was advised by email from the Jail that the defendant is currently in custody on P&P hold, and notes he never reported back on 08/08/2022 to serve his sentence as ordered back on 08/05/2022.  Per Judge Todd Martens defendant is to now serve the 50 Days Jail Straight Time, Huber has been revoked.  Court to prepare and sign an Amended JOC.  Jail was advised of this change by email as well. (am)

ADDRESS INFO for Charles S Kelley Jr
Current: 801 N. East Ave., Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: Unknown,
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:27 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Charles S Kelley in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and confirms with counsel they are prepared to proceed today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Sonderhouse confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.

Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Gordon.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Sonderhouse.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

50 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (24 Days Credit).  Defendant to report to the Huber Facilty by 6:00 p.m. on 08/08/2022.

COSTS: $268.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: Court to apply the $100.00 Cash Bail on deposit; remainder to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09/01/2022.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Returned Notice of Hearing as Addressed to Charles S Kelley Jr for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on 8-05-2022 at 2:30pm
Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as Addressed. Unable to Forward

10:35 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Charles S Kelley in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Sonderhouse provides an update, he is just waiting on an offer.  Atty. Sonderhouse requests a projected plea and sentencing date.  Atty. Gordon advises she has an offer and will email it to Atty. Sonderhouse.  Court will adjourn for projected plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. Sonderhouse.
